findings.title: Incorrect check for calldata overrun in CALLDATACOPY
findings.description: The intention of the code is to check offset + size < txCalldataLen, but at this point A contains txCalldataLen + size and B contains offset, so it checks txCalldataLen + size < offset, which doesn’t make sense.

findings.title: PUSH at end of code can read wrong value
findings.description: When a PUSH opcode appears at the end of the bytecode whose data area spans beyond the end of the bytecode, the zkEVM will read the truncated value.
